com.ezrebclan.asset

Class Asset<Type>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ezrebclan.asset.Asset<Type>
  • Type Parameters:
    Type - The type of the asset's data
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Loadable, Saveable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BigTextAsset, ImageAsset, SmallTextAsset

    public abstract class Asset<Type>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Saveable, Loadable
    An Asset is anything that gets loaded by your code. Some examples are Images, Models, Plain Text, Raw Object Data, and Scripts.
    An Asset object holds two things, the data itself, and an AssetIndex object. The index object holds information about the data.

    Assets can be exported, by calling the save() method and providing an OutputStream to write to, which is typically a FileOutputStream, but could be anything.
    Assets can also be imported, by constructing them with an InputStream to get the data from. Again, this is typically a FileInputStream, but could be anything.

    Since the Asset class is abstract, you can't really use it very easily. Instead, use one of the subclasses:
    • ImageAsset
    • SmallTextAsset
    • BigTextAsset
    Author:
    Mrab Ezreb

      • saveData

        protected abstract void saveData(java.io.OutputStream output)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Called when saving the asset. Subclasses override this in order to save the asset's data into the asset object.
        Parameters:
        output - This is a direct reference to the asset's outputstream. Write the asset DIRECTLY to this parameter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws any exceptions

      • loadData

        protected abstract Type loadData(java.io.InputStream input)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Called when loading the asset. Subclasses override this in order to load the asset's data into the asset object.
        Parameters:
        input - This is a direct reference to the asset's inputstream. Read the asset DIRECTLY from this parameter.
        Returns:
        The asset data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws any exceptions
